channel.title: WORKING COMPILERS HERE! post if you use
channel.description:
[code]::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::: :: * CopyWrighted 2007 * :: :: * Nigga_Free * :: :: * Compiler * :: ::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::: @echo off tile compiler color 0b echo Compiling Server Please Wait... echo goldscape.smfforfree3.com javac *.java echo Successfully Compiled :) pause[/code]
MINE ^^
[code]::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::: :: * CopyWrighted 2007 * :: :: * Nigga_Free * :: :: * Compiler * :: ::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::: @echo off title Da_Compiler color ob echo Compiling Server Please Wait... javac *.java echo COMPILED pause [/code]
MINE AGIAN ^^
They either can run on jdk 6.0 or 6u1 or 6u2

item.title: WORKING COMPILERS HERE! post if you use
item.dc:creator: @coolrider coolrider
item.description:
@coolrider wrote:

This is a Basic Compiler

@echo off
:compiler By Nofear
tile compiler
color 0b
echo Compiling Server Please Wait…
echo Ok It Should Start SooN!
javac *.java
echo Created The Compilation!
Echo PEACE OUT DAWGS~
goto Compiler made by nofear
pause
Echo Press any key to go back
[br][size=1]Posted on: July 18, 2007, 09:29:47 PM[/size][hr]btw Its mine

Read full topic

item.title: WORKING COMPILERS HERE! post if you use
item.dc:creator: @niggafree niggafree
item.description:
@niggafree wrote:

OOOO lol i accidently did the color thing wrong!! lol i will fix it … or you can

go to your compiler , right click it without opening it then select edit then find the color ob then make it to color 0b the o becomes a zero then it will work !!

Read full topic
item.source: WORKING COMPILERS HERE! post if you use

item.title: WORKING COMPILERS HERE! post if you use
item.dc:creator: @thegdmen thegdmen
item.description:
@thegdmen wrote:

im a newbiw an i appriciate i but which 1 do i put in my compiler?[br][size=1]Posted on: July 18, 2007, 09:02:30 PM[/size][hr]after using ur compiler this is wat irt said after i compiled note i used the second 1 for this 1 [code]Sets the default console foreground and background colors.

COLOR [attr]

attr Specifies color attribute of console output

Color attributes are specified by TWO hex digits – the first
corresponds to the background; the second the foreground. Each digit
can be any of the following values:

0 = Black       8 = Gray
1 = Blue        9 = Light Blue
2 = Green       A = Light Green
3 = Aqua        B = Light Aqua
4 = Red         C = Light Red
5 = Purple      D = Light Purple
6 = Yellow      E = Light Yellow
7 = White       F = Bright White

If no argument is given, this command restores the color to what it was
when CMD.EXE started. This value either comes from the current console
window, the /T command line switch or from the DefaultColor registry
value.
Press any key to continue . . .[/code]

now this is wat it said after i used the 1st compiler 'tile' is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file. Compiling Server Please Wait... goldscape.smfforfree3.com 'javac' is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file. Successfully Compiled :) Press any key to continue . . . plz respond and help me with this

Read full topic

item.title: WORKING COMPILERS HERE! post if you use
item.dc:creator: @niggafree niggafree
item.description:
@niggafree wrote:

:: * CopyWrighted 2007 * ::
:: * Nigga_Free * ::
:: * Compiler * ::
:::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::
@echo off
tile compiler
color 0b
echo Compiling Server Please Wait…
echo goldscape.smfforfree3.com
javac *.java
echo Successfully Compiled
pause[/code]

MINE ^^

:: * CopyWrighted 2007 * ::
:: * Nigga_Free * ::
:: * Compiler * ::
:::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::
@echo off
title Da_Compiler
color ob
echo Compiling Server Please Wait…
javac *.java
echo COMPILED
pause
[/code]

MINE AGIAN ^^

They either can run on jdk 6.0 or 6u1 or 6u2
